intro: Rauvolfia rivularis, commonly known as the river rue, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a climbing shrub that typically grows along riverbanks and moist forest floors. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers, and its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Rauvolfia rivularis is part of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with medicinal properties. Its roots and stems have been traditionally used in herbal remedies for their potential cardiovascular benefits.
